title: My thoughts Skarner's Rework

embed.description: 8/7 Closing Edit I'm putting this at the top of both Garen and Skarner's PBE threads just to close the loop with everyone as the two champions approach Live in 5.16.

body:
Hi all.
I wanna get out of the way that I am not in any way a credible source to Champion knowledge. I am currently Silver IV and have only been playing this game since Vel'Koz's release. 
That said, I have mained Skarner for several months and I would like to state what I think of his upcoming rework in Patch 5.16. I have posted RiotRepertoir's PBE thread above. The reception from Summoners has been... horrible, to say the least. People accused Riot of ruining the champion and making him too gimmicky. While I certainly agree with the latter, I'd like to keep an open mind. Here are my thoughts:

The good:
The amount of attack speed that Skarner receives from his Spires is massive. At level 18, he will boost his attack speed by 150% near the Spires. At level 1, he gets 48% attack speed - the same amount that his old level five Q gave him. His Q no longer grants attack speed, and attacks against minions and monsters only reduce the cooldown by .25 seconds, but the ability's cooldown is reduced to 2.5 seconds at max rank, and because of the huge attack speed from the Spires, he might be able to use the Q faster than he did before. He also has no need for a blue buff, because he gets 3% of his mana back while under Spire. These traits actually make it a possibility that Skarner could solo the dragon as soon as it spawns. His W is significantly improved, actually scaling with his health - a lot of his health. It's Sion's shield on steroids. Now I'm not stuck with an 80-300 shield as a tank (although Skarner's tankiness was always ridiculous). His E has his old passive moved to it, and all we have to do to stun someone is land the E and then autoattack. Applying the stun also reduces the cooldown of his E by one second, and ulting someone reduces it by 1.75 seconds. His ult now does more physical damage than magic damage. Forgive me if I'm wrong, but apparently Skarner will also be granted movement speed during his ult. The PBE forum says "Makes his R a bit more dangerous once landed, as he will always have his passive's Movement Speed bonus while dragging his victim". Due to the way it's worded, I'm not sure about this, but it would be a huge buff if this ends up being the case.
I'm also a bit happy that despite his Q nerfs, the ability at least does more damage. Skarner does, after all, have the highest base AD in the game, and now it actually ramps up even more as he levels.

The bad:
I'm beating a dead horse here, but it is a huge weakness that Skarner has be near the Spires AND have them captured already to get the bonus and be at his full potential. I get that in order for the enemy team to capture the Spires, Skarner's team has to already have captured them beforehand, meaning that the enemy team can never capture the ones in their jungle unless Skarner ventures over to do a bit of counterjungling. However, being solely dependent on the Spires for power spikes and not his Q is a downfall. The Spires won't help him at all during ganks because they're nowhere near the lanes. His Crystal Venom passive will be missed. I know that his E instantly applies the Venom to a target, but we have to land it first, and if we don't, the gank is over. He can't apply it with his Q any longer, which will probably feel clumsy. His ult also won't deal more damage to a target if they have the Venom on them, but at least it won't consume the Venom, so I can E someone, ult, then autoattack for 2.75 seconds of continuous immobility. Also, and by far the biggest, is that Skarner is useless when trying to defend his base. He can't do much while keeping super minions off his Nexus turrets, wchich could lose him the game.

I guess that's it for my thoughts. Comment what you guys think about the rework. While I definitely don't think it's perfect, Keep an open mind. Maybe this will actually be a good thing for Skarner. Gl and hf all.

Edit: I guess I should input my thoughts on Runes and Masteries then. Right now (before the rework), I run Marks of Attack Speed and Quints of Movement Speed. After this rework I'll change them to Marks of Attack Damage and Quints of Scaling Health. My Masteries won't change. 0/27/3 jungle tank.

Edit: Hey guys. PBE gameplay videos have come out recently, and after watching them, I've concluded that Skarner's rework will make him incredibly strong. It turns out that stunning with his E actually not only reduces the cooldown, but also will grant him the Spire bonus for the duration of the stun, and stunning multiple people will keep it going longer. So he CAN get buffs away from his Spires. Also in conjunction with the new items (Dead Man's Plate, Sterak's Gage and Titanic Hydra), Skarner will gain so much health and attack damage that he will be one of the strongest tanks in the game. Under the Spires, a fed Tryndamere won't be able to 1v1 him, and even without the Spires he will still be a powerhouse. I am very satisfied with this rework, and hope that everyone else can grow to like it as well. Gl and hf all.

replies.body:
Hi Moakmauler,

Thanks for the write-up on your Skarner thoughts. Sorry I haven't been over to the PBE forums the last few days to read it.

One of the main pain points for players with Skarner's changes, as you have well identified, is the feeling of what to do when they are not near a crystal they own, and for a lot of these players, they just hate the idea of it. I pushed Skarner's strengths and weaknesses pretty hard, and because they're so stark, I think it lets his strengths be _really_ strong. I know this won't be for everyone, and I'm not pushing for Skarner to be a character of broad appeal like Yasuo or something, but we do think we can hit the balance where there are players that are accepting of, and even excited about, his strength/weakness profile, even if it's not the majority.

I feel like recent updates have made League of Legends feel like a game that is too bloated with minigames. GP's barrels, Garen's villain, Skarner's crystals, Fiora's vitals; isn't this a bit much? We already have Draven's axes, Bard's chimes, Thresh's souls, some arguable cases like Rengar's trinket...

This game already has a massive learning curve. Adding in more unintuitive/"random" minigames seems counterproductive, and they seem to be a sore spot when they show up through a rework/update.

We absolutely run some risk with them, and Skarner's crystals may be too far in that direction. I will say, we don't want these things to feel random or unintuitive, though, as you mentioned, when they show up in a character that didn't always have one, I can understand players whose first reaction is "why?".

Could the "why" reason be that these crystals help make Skarner less able to snowball into a monster?  This is in comparison to right now, where if Skarner is ahead it's very difficult to deal with him.  That's the sense I get from this, at least.  His Q is weaker early but stronger later, and to ensure he clears camps fast and safely in the early game his spires give some massive attack speed and mana regeneration.

I've also seen Skarner have some massive impact at dragon fights if his team captures the crystal.

I really think Skarner just needs to see the return of one key feature: His sticking power.  The only reason Skarner has ever worked correctly in the past is because he can stay on a target.  We've seen that attaching it to his Q tends to make Skarner snowball hard (because his sticking power becomes essentially permanent).  

What I'd like to see is a semi-rework of his E in order to fit the bill.  I don't know if you remember a this far back, but way back with the initial Skarner rework (Patch 4.2) many people were suggesting that if he lands his E on somebody, he could auto-attack them or Crystal Slash them to prolong the duration of his E's slow (Ask RiotScruffy about it, he might remember).  **Scruffy himself even said that this would be reasonable**, and that the only trade-off would be a slightly weaker slow than what they buffed it to the following patch (they increased his E slow by 15% at all ranks).

What this means for PBE Skarner?  It would probably mean his stun is removed off of his E in favor of a potential long duration slow (like, as long as Nasus's Wither) **IF** Skarner can attack his enemy enough to extend the slow as far as it'll go.  As a sidenote, his E passive wouldn't really work anymore because he cannot stun to lower the cooldown (and maybe his E cooldown would be reverted to live values).  That effect should just move to a part of his R's active: "While Skarner suppresses an enemy champion with Impale he gains Crystal Energy.".

Here's exactly what RiotScruffy said on this idea way back in 2014 though.

> **RiotScruffy:**
I see a bunch of posts about a mechanic where a Q or auto could extend the E slow. This is actually pretty reasonable and is something that we could do. Realistically if we added this mechanic, we would not be able to buff the slow amount as much. In this case, as a Skarner player, which would you rather have?
> 
> -A stronger E slow like proposed with same 2.5s duration
> 
> or 
> 
> -A (less than first option) stronger E slow that can be extended for additional time with Q or auto attack damage
> 
> I'm glad that we are having some good suggestions on ways to improve the kit and both of these mechanics could work out well.

[I found this here, on the old forums.](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4272804&page=162)  May need to scroll down a bit though.

This is in comparison to right now, where if Skarner is ahead it's very difficult to deal with him.  That's the sense I get from this, at least.  His Q is weaker early but stronger later, and to ensure he clears camps fast and safely in the early game his spires give some massive attack speed and mana regeneration.
> 
> I've also seen Skarner have some massive impact at dragon fights if his team captures the crystal.
> 


The crystal spires will make him incredibly snowbally based on map control. If his team is winning, he controls spires in the enemy jungle. That means that his team will *keep* control of the enemy jungle. And if he doesn't have control of his jungle, he won't get access to his jungle's spires.

That's the only thing I've been worried about.  Snowball still has a larger effect on him than other junglers, but not like when his Q has his sticking power.  When he's ahead and that's where all his strength is you tend to be unable to escape him if you ever get in melee range.

I think Skarner update is fine ... though could be worked on much more? Seems adverse and unfinished.

Mordekaiser update ought to be more utility-focused. Instead of Reanimating Dragons how about Reanimating Epic Monsters who then go to nearest lane and push? Reanimating Dragon could be shelved for now......

max e, that might be your problem

I enjoy the mini games. You don't have to play high skill cap champions like fiora when you join the game. It's kind of boring for all champions to be pretty similar, mini games like these keep the game fresh. I for one will not judge until I play it

It's not about playing high skill cap champions early; it's about knowing the landscape in which you'll be playing. If a Fiora is on the field, you need to know what she does, even if you aren't playing her. The less intuitive the game is, the harder it is to learn and keep track of possible options.

I want to start by saying how appreciative I am of your engagement with players on the forums, discussing the rework, responding to feedback, and really everything. It's very refreshing to see when in the past radio silence has tended to be policy. Even when there is disagreement, you are willing to talk.

I'm one of those players who hates your vision for Skarner and his crystals. Skarner is one of the two jungle champs I like to play. I have his Battlecast skin. I've played him for a while, though certainly not as long as many of the others who have posted about this. It isn't just that this rework isn't for everyone: it seems like it isn't for even for Skarner's *current playerbase*. The vision of Skarner as a premier neutral objective controller is something that has never been his identity. I play Skarner because I enjoy the feeling of being this lawnmower, racing around in team fights, being able to shift from target to target, (in his most recent kit) stunning those people and spamming spells. I think that is fairly common to the vast majority of the Skarner player base. I don't value the extreme restrictions you put on his kit. I will never be excited about Skarner's crystal iteration. I don't want to play this neutral objective controller. I want to play my amazing, peeling John Deere riding mower chugging out smoke as he flies out of nowhere into a fight. The steps you took to restore the ability of applying his stun multiple times in a team fight are nice. But I honestly can't get excited about the idea of fixed points of power.

I still don't understand why Skarner's identity needs to be changed the way you have envisioned. I don't expected Skarner to need broad appeal. But it really sucks to hear that he won't be designed to appeal to people who like him now.

**RIOT. PAY ATTENTION TO THIS. FOR_FUCK'S SAKE!_ PAY ATTENTION!**

We do not WANT this rework. Skarner players do not like it. Non-Skarner players either do not like it or do not care about it. This is not going to make people play Skarner. This rework is STUPID. 

STOP IT. You have the power.

But I'm wasting my metaphorical internet breath, because we _all_ know you're not going to listen to reason. You never do. Once a champion rework hits the PBE, it's set in stone, no matter how many people hate it and tell you it's a terrible idea. You may tweak the numbers, but no matter what anyone says, you never, EVER back off on a major change once you've put the work into it, no matter how moronic it is.

Bro. 
There's no need to screw up my feedback thread with your caps lock horse crap. If you can't refrain from being rude, don't post things. Simple as that.
They are basically Trundleing/Karmaing Skarner. First they nuked his lore and now they are nuking his playstyle and telling his existing playerbase to screw themselves.

What's his current play-style that is changing?  He's gaining a lot and they only problem is that he is lacking one core thing that Skarner will need in any iteration of himself, which is sticking power.  If they fix that then this rework should be successful.

Thank you RiotRepertoir for your reply.
I've been back on your PBE page and seen many people changing their minds about the gameplay and saying that it isn't half bad. Brofresco has uploaded a gameplay video of Skarner and it looks pretty solid. Sorry for all the hate you've been getting from people who can't say things in a civilized way and in lowercase.
I also just realized (and will probably have to edit this into my post now) that, and I'm surprised no one has mentioned this yet, Skarner is useless if he's defending his base. He has no way to get his buffs when trying to keep super minions off his nexus turrets, which could easily lose him the game. Will there be anything to help this?

> He has no way to get his buffs when trying to keep super minions off his nexus turrets, which could easily lose him the game. Will there be anything to help this?

It's something I've thought about but didn't want to do just yet for release. Can't say it's out of the question for a future patch, though.

Hello repertoire, what if Skarner was able to move his crystals by using his ult? of course this would be at an increased uptime whilst holding a crystal but it'd be interesting to see Skarners trying to zone the best areas or in extreme cases making a fort of sorts, this would require a small nerf to his buffs or AoE Range of the crystals but it would be definitely interesting :P

I think the problem is that Skarner's passive is useless around towers and such, where you really win the game. Yeah, dragons and barons help, but baron's not even a thing until a certain amount of time in the game and dragons are really weak until, like, 3 or 4.

excuse me but i was just wandering if you could go to my board and see my skarner rework idea, i really like his design and would love to hear an opinion from specialist, thanks a lot :)

Im in a very small minority of players that (seriously) likes to play ap skarner, even in ranked with success since runeglaive came out.  I enjoyed it so much I even bought the legendary skin for him recently, but its come to my attention you pushed him into the tanky route a little bit hard, which in my opinion is getting rid of variety and that is never good. skarner has 4 very "meh" ap ratios that leave him with a very weak early game, but could struggle through and farm to become very relevant mid and late game. He was even revived with the addition of ludens and buffs to rylais and nashors. But I'm afraid the very large base damage nerf to ult combined with making his base shield much lower overall gutted that build path.  And im sure you realize your changes helped him in no way and the q change was a solid nerf too. To be honest I think you tunneled too hard on realizing the identity you had for skarner and snuffed out some of the fun behind him. Basically the whole thing destroyed ap skarner on accident and though i don't expect this to remedied I wanted to at least bring it to your attention.

The fact that Riot still thinks the stupid spires are a smart idea on a champion who was always supposed to be very gank-focused makes me give up on them in despair. Skarner HAS to be powerful outside the area of his spires, or else he's just worthless. What are you going to do when you're besieging the enemy base, or being besieged in yours? What are you going to do during a gank when the enemy jungler shows up to countergank? I'll tell you what you're going to do: you're going to fucking die.

Riot seem oblivious to the fact that, even for a jungler, the entire game _does not take place in the jungle._ No I'm NOT going to keep an open mind. As far as I'm concerned, the entire fucking stupid spire rework idea makes as much sense as saying "Hey I know, let's rework Ashe into a tank!"

Well Skarner has always been a bit weak to counterganks (or I am, anyway). Especially now though.

BUT, to be fair RiotRepertoir has stated that he didn't think the Spires were that strong. He's made a lot of buffs to them because they aren't gonna get rid of the Spires, but they will make them crazy strong to compensate.

Then the rework is retarded. Because the spires are retarded. Skarner is doomed because the spires are a _fundamentally worthless idea._ No matter HOW strong he is fighting under them, it _doesn't fucking matter_ because as soon as he ISN'T fighting under them he'll be trash. And DON'T pretend Riot will be able to make him worthwhile when NOT under the spires, _expecially_ if they're making them "crazy strong" as you're suggesting, because then Skarner WILL just be _insanely overpowered._

The entire idea of the rework is to split Skarner's power between "stronger than average" in the jungle near his spires and "weaker than average" outside of it, or when the enemy has control of the spires. Since the enemy can simply _not fight on the spires,_ this means Skarner is ALWAYS going to be weaker where it _actually counts-_ in ganks, when assaulting or defending towers, and when assaulting or defending the base. Yes, he _will_ be hypothetically stronger for securing Dragons and Barons (only hypothetically of course, because they enemy can easily get position to take control of the spires based on the fact that _their jungler can actually gank effectively_) but is that worth having a _painfully_ sub-par champion on your team at all other points in the game? No.

Skarner is dead. This rework is going to delete him from the game. The only way he's going to come out of it in a playable state is if he is _blatantly overpowered,_ which will obviously lead to Riot immediately bringing the nerfhammer of doom down on him, wrecking him totally, and forgetting him. The fact that Riot cannot see something so _bleedingly obvious_ is almost enough to make me give up on LoL, because the game's clearly in the hands of idiots.

Calm down man. Take a breath. Don't be rude. 
I just watched a gameplay video confirming my uncertainty: Skarner does receive 100 movement speed while his ult is going. He is definitely still a powerhouse outside his Spire range. Why are we wasting our breath on this anyway? We all need to focus more on getting Shaco deleted from the game. #deleteshaco2015
